questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A newly configured PC fails to connect to the internet by using TCP port 80 to www.cisco.com. Which setting must be modified for the connection to work?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer is correct, 10.2.2.0/29, 10.2.2.0 - 10.2.2.7, the current config is 10.2.2.10, which is out of range, and needs to be changed

Selected Answer: A
unclear question 
Who know if it's wrong with subnet mask or GW sometime GW is correct but subnet should change.

Selected Answer: C
usable ip adresses: 10.2.2.1-10.2.2.6
Broadcast:10.2.2.7
network:10.2.2.0
gateway: 10.2.2.10 is out of range

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

the current Default Gateway is out of the range

Selected Answer: C
The IP address of the default gateway is the network ID of the network 10.2.2.0/29, not a usable IP address and we must change it.

questions.question_text: How does frame switching function on a switch?

choices.A: rewrites the source and destination MAC address
choices.C: forwards known destinations to the destination port
choices.B: forwards frames to a neighbor port using CDP
choices.D: is disabled by default on all interfaces and VLANs

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the characteristic from the left onto the IPv6 address type on the right.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
given answer is not correct, 
anycast : assigned to multiple devices, & routed to the nearest interface
multicast: cant be used as a source address and provides communication one to many

Anycast:
- is assigned to multiple devices on the same network simultaneously
- is routed to the nearest interface that has the address

Multicast:
- provides one-to-many communications
- cannot be used as a source address

given answers are incorrect


Anycast:
- is assigned to multiple devices on the same network simultaneously
- is routed to the nearest interface that has the address

Multicast:
- provides one-to-many communications
- cannot be used as a source address

multicast addresses are not assigned, devices join the group address

correct order:

multicast-one to many
 -cannot be use as source

anycast -- assigned to multiple devices
 - nearest

correct
Anycast : cant be used as a source address (https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/doc/EDOC1100064351/84269de5/ipv6-address-anycast)

incorrect
Anycast : assigned multiple, routed to the nearest
Multicast : cant be used to source, provides communication

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

comments.content:
SSID (Service Set Identifier) is a unique name that is assigned to the AP.
A WLAN's name is assigned by the network administrator and can be different from the APs connected to it.
I admit that I was wrong cause APs can be named the same. That leaves option D. the only choice that I reluctantly agree to. Poorly worded question.

"The SSID is a unique identifier that 'wireless network devices' use to establish and maintain wireless connectivity."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/interfaces-modules/security-modules-routers-switches/116586-config-ap-00.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer.
SSID (Service Set Identifier) is a unique name that is assigned to a wireless network .

choices.C: prompts a user for a login ID
choices.D: associates a name to a WLAN
choices.A: uses policies to prevent unauthorized users
choices.B: identifies an access point on a WLAN

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of an SSID in wireless networks?
